examples: We must confront the fact that racial inequality exists in our society.

meanings.definition: Something that has an influence on something that happens or is one of the causes of it.

examples: Deciding what determinants should be relevant in admissions decisions can be controversial.

meanings.definition: To make someone do something because of a law or moral principle.
examples: She was upset when the Supreme Court ruled that Michigan state universities were not obligated to retain affirmative action in admissions.
She was upset when the Supreme Court ruled that Michigan state universities were not required to retain affirmative action in admissions.

meanings.definition: Having to do with a school.
examples: In short, he felt that people believed he had been accepted into Yale only because of his race, and not as a result of his academic achievement.

images.caption: When people are excited about learning, academic success goes up!

meanings.definition: The act of treating some people unfairly because of prejudice.
examples: The civil rights movement fought to bring an end to discrimination in this country.

meanings.definition: Related to what is being discussed or is presently important.
examples: The comment about cooking is not relevant to our discussion about sports.
